subject: Programming
title: The Apollo 11 Alarm
description: Learn The Apollo 11 Alarm in one minute.

hook.text: Three minutes before the Moon landing, alarms blared in the lunar module.

buildup.text: The computer threw 1202 and 1201 errors â€” executive overflow. Too many tasks, too little memory.

discovery.text: A mistakenly left-on radar switch was flooding the computer with unnecessary data.

twist.text: The software was designed to prioritize. It dropped low-priority tasks and kept landing on track.

climax.text: Margaret Hamilton's priority system saved the mission. The landing succeeded.

punchline.text: Good error handling landed humans on the Moon.

quiz.question: What saved the Apollo 11 landing during the computer alarms?
